ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Defines spatial data types and supports geometrical operations on them. Data types include point patterns, windows (domains), pixel images, line segment patterns, tessellations and hyperframes. Capabilities include creation and manipulation of data (using command line or graphical interaction), plotting, geometrical operations (rotation, shift, rescale, affine transformation), convex hull, discretisation and pixellation, Dirichlet tessellation, Delaunay triangulation, pairwise distances, nearest-neighbour distances, distance transform, morphological operations (erosion, dilation, closing, opening), quadrat counting, geometrical measurement, geometrical covariance, colour maps, calculus on spatial domains, Gaussian blur, level sets of images, transects of images, intersections between objects, minimum distance matching. (Excludes spatial data on a network, which are supported by the package 'spatstat.linnet'.)

name: r-spatstat.geom

about.summary: Defines spatial data types and supports geometrical operations on them. Data types include point patterns, windows (domains), pixel images, line segment patterns, tessellations and hyperframes. Capabilities include creation and manipulation of data (using command line or graphical interaction), plotting, geometrical operations (rotation, shift, rescale, affine transformation), convex hull, discretisation and pixellation, Dirichlet tessellation, Delaunay triangulation, pairwise distances, nearest-neighbour distances, distance transform, morphological operations (erosion, dilation, closing, opening), quadrat counting, geometrical measurement, geometrical covariance, colour maps, calculus on spatial domains, Gaussian blur, level sets of images, transects of images, intersections between objects, minimum distance matching. (Excludes spatial data on a network, which are supported by the package 'spatstat.linnet'.)

Defines spatial data types and supports geometrical operations on them. Data types include point patterns, windows (domains), pixel images, line segment patterns, tessellations and hyperframes. Capabilities include creation and manipulation of data (using command line or graphical interaction), plotting, geometrical operations (rotation, shift, rescale, affine transformation), convex hull, discretisation and pixellation, Dirichlet tessellation, Delaunay triangulation, pairwise distances, nearest-neighbour distances, distance transform, morphological operations (erosion, dilation, closing, opening), quadrat counting, geometrical measurement, geometrical covariance, colour maps, calculus on spatial domains, Gaussian blur, level sets of images, transects of images, intersections between objects, minimum distance matching. (Excludes spatial data on a network, which are supported by the package 'spatstat.linnet'.)

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "3.7-0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-spatstat.geom
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/spatstat.geom_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/spatstat.geom/spatstat.geom_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 5375b2ad0613a5a4de1484c32f98688109c1ea3341eb071b398f813b78b9d5e7

build:
  number: 0
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}  # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-deldir                   # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-polyclip                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-spatstat.data            # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-spatstat.univar          # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-spatstat.utils           # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - {{ compiler('c') }}        # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}          # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}  # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}    # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem      # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed             # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils       # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip             # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-deldir >=1.0_2
    - r-polyclip >=1.10_0
    - r-spatstat.data >=3.1
    - r-spatstat.univar >=3.1_0
    - r-spatstat.utils >=3.1_2
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-deldir >=1.0_2
    - r-polyclip >=1.10_0
    - r-spatstat.data >=3.1
    - r-spatstat.univar >=3.1_0
    - r-spatstat.utils >=3.1_2

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('spatstat.geom')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('spatstat.geom')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://spatstat.org/
  dev_url: https://github.com/spatstat/spatstat.geom
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: Defines spatial data types and supports geometrical operations on them. Data types include point patterns, windows (domains), pixel images, line segment patterns, tessellations and hyperframes. Capabilities include creation and manipulation of data (using command line or graphical interaction), plotting, geometrical
    operations (rotation, shift, rescale, affine transformation), convex hull, discretisation and pixellation, Dirichlet tessellation, Delaunay triangulation, pairwise distances, nearest-neighbour distances, distance transform, morphological operations (erosion, dilation, closing, opening), quadrat counting, geometrical
    measurement, geometrical covariance, colour maps, calculus on spatial domains, Gaussian blur, level sets of images, transects of images, intersections between objects, minimum distance matching. (Excludes spatial data on a network, which are supported by the package 'spatstat.linnet'.)
  license_family: GPL
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
